text: Superficial muscular aponeurotic system (SMAS) is an area of musculature of the face. This muscular system is manipulated during facial cosmetic surgery, especially rhytidectomy. The SMAS extends from the platysma to the galea aponeurotica and is continuous with temporoparietal fascia and galea. It connects to the dermis via vertical septa. ==See also== * Facial muscles * Body modification * Minimal access cranial suspension (MACS) ==External links== * Facelift, SMAS Plication Category:Plastic surgery Category:Oral and maxillofacial surgery Category:Otorhinolaryngology
title: Superficial muscular aponeurotic system
